cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 95 miles ENE of Daytona Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving NNW today, turning north tonight and N-NE on Thursday, skirting the Georgia coast and then tracking very near or over the South Carolina coast before accelerating northeastward toward North Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the central South Carolina coast (around the Charleston–Georgetown stretch)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to Savannah River GA/SC border and north of Surf City NC to NC/VA border including Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Volusia/Brevard County FL line to Ponte Vedra Beach FL and from north of Savannah River SC to Surf City NC; Storm Surge Warning from Sebastian Inlet FL to Surf City NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from east-central Florida through Georgia and the coasts of South Carolina and North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds expected to begin later today with a 54% chance of sustained 50-kt (58-mph) winds; hurricane-force gusts possible as the core nears on Thursday night.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 4–7 ft above ground level is forecast for the Charleston area if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches of rain with isolated amounts to 15 inches could produce flash flooding in and around the port region.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents and a low-end tornado risk on Thursday.
